case_title: REHMAT KHAN vs KHUSHI MUHAMMAD AND ANOTHER

defense: Counsel for Khushi Muhammad and Another

complaint_summary: Dispute over appointment of Lambardar for Chak No. 97/W.B., Tehsil Vehari following the death of Zain Khan.
investigation_summary: The A.C./Collector appointed Rehmat Khan as Lambardar based on ownership of 12i acres and majority community status. Commissioner Multan remanded the case for fresh determination under rule 19(1) of the Land Revenue Rules.

judgment_summary.background: On the death of Zain Khan, Lambardar of Chak No. 97/W.B., Tehsil Vehari, the A.C./Collector, Vehari appointed Rehmat Khan as successor Lambardar based on ownership of 12i acres and belonging to the majority community.
judgment_summary.commissioner_decision: The learned Commissioner, Multan set aside the A.C./Collector's decision and remanded the case for fresh determination under rule 19(1) of the Land Revenue Rules.
judgment_summary.appeal_arguments: Rehmat Khan's counsel presented verified statements showing 952 acres out of 1155 acres under proprietary holding and established that Zain Khan was a permanent Lambardar.
judgment_summary.court_decision: Considering the proprietary nature of the Chak and the prior claim of Rehmat Khan based on primogeniture, the appeal was accepted, and Rehmat Khan was appointed Lambardar of Chak No. 97/W.B.

Decision_or_verdict: Appeal accepted; Rehmat Khan appointed as Lambardar.
legal_arguments: Appellant argued proprietary holdings of 952 acres out of 1155 acres.
Previous incumbent Zain Khan was a permanent Lambardar.
sections: Rule 19(1) of the Land Revenue Rules

witness_statement.Tehsildar, Vehari: Verified proprietary holdings of 952 acres out of total 1155 acres.

key_issues: Proprietary holdings as basis for appointment

maxims.Primogeniture: The right of succession belonging to the firstborn child.

legal_terms.Lambardar: A village headman responsible for revenue collection and administrative duties.

words_and_phrases.Proprietary holdings: Land owned by individuals rather than the state.

summary_vector_notes: Case involves dispute over Lambardar appointment following Zain Khan's death. Rehmat Khan's appeal was accepted based on proprietary holdings and primogeniture principle.
